instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message:
so I have this dead macbook, i reball the smc and solve the no ssd problem, there's image, there's backlight, then apple logo, but loading is a bit slow, when it got to dekstop, the ui is all smaller, when i check about this mac
graphics : 15 mb ,( instead of intel iris something )
when I check display tab, it says 42 inch 2560x1600, does this mean the internal display's information isn't read correctly or ? I have searched for similar problem but doesnt found any.., I have tried cleaning me and reflash bios

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: Everything is smaller, its like when you use 4k monitor, but the ui is sharper but smaller..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R8312</RESISTOR> is knocked off board so i have replaced it too

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message:
Did you try known good compatible LCD?
What about external video?
Is SMC the original from the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: Yeah already with other known good lcd still same, smc still original, i just reflowed it, wait i will check for external

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message:
Still the same on external?
Disconnect  internal LCD, when test it.

Was the image correct, before reballing SMC?
Check voltages and diode mode at <RESISTOR>R5350</RESISTOR>/51, pin 2.
Also check <SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUX</SIGNAL> data lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: Solved : i think I accidentally shuffled some smc, because of messy table, change smc with another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and display works fine now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display problem
threads.message: Just for info, i have tried <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with wrong smc from macbook air or 13inch pro retina's smc, the board will have varying reaction, some will boot up with display problem, some will just have blank screen.. But keyboard backlit is on
